entries.meaning: A loud, eager cry, usually of joy.
A gasp, characteristic of whooping cough.

verbs.description: whoop (third-person singular simple present whoops, present participle whooping, simple past and past participle whooped)

examples: each whooping with a merry shout

entries.meaning: To cough or breathe with a sonorous inspiration, as in whooping cough.
(transitive, obsolete) To insult with shouts; to chase with derision.

description: From a traditional African American and Southern US pronunciation of whip.

verbs.description: whoop (third-person singular simple present whoops, present participle whooping, simple past and past participle whooped)
